value.title: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server  In this video, I walk through the steps to create your Power BI Report in order to publish it to Power BI Report Server. This involves downloading and installing Power BI Desktop optimized for Power BI Report Server and connecting to Analysis Services
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/j1u3FffHkGo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7

value.title: Filter Power BI reports using a URL query string
value.excerpt: In this video, I show you how to filter Power BI reports, within the Power BI service, using a URL query string.  This is actually documented here - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-service-share-unshare-dashboard/#share-just-a-report  In addition to showing you how to filter

value.title: How do you even use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI???
value.excerpt: Not sure how to use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI to optimize your data model? Marco Russo joins Patrick to show you how! value.title: INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground (2021)
value.excerpt: Want to try things out with Power BI Embedded? Want to explore the JavaScript API? Try embedding with your own report? Then you need to check out the INSANE AMAZING updates for the Power BI Embedded Playground! Amit Shuster walks us through the revamp. value.title: No Calendar Table? How to add Fiscal Month and Sort in Power BI?
value.excerpt: Thinking you don't need a date table in Power BI? What about Fiscal month? Patrick shows how you could potentially go about adding that without a full date table.  But really, use a central date table 😎  Do you need a date table for time intelligence in Power BI? Nope! (Quick Measures) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2f7dYB1l84g

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?

This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: How to Create Power BI Account without a Work Email 📧 (Use Gmail/Outlook/Hotmail)
value.excerpt: Have you tried creating a PowerBI.com account online but got stuck because you did not have a Work Email? Let me show you the best workaround you can use, to create a Power BI account if you just have a Gmail, Outlook or Hotmail address.  ➔ Links mentioned in the Video ▪️ Power BI Tutorial From Beginner
